statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
You know YaoYao is fond of his chains. He has a lot of chains and each chain has n diamonds on it. There are two kinds of diamonds, labeled 0 and 1. We can write down the label of diamonds on a chain. So each chain can be written as a sequence consisting of 0 and 1.
We know that chains are different with each other. And their length is exactly n. And what’s more, each chain sequence doesn’t contain “101” as a substring.
Could you tell how many chains will YaoYao have at most?

statement.title: Input
statement.content: There will be multiple test cases in a test data. For each test case, there is only one number n(n<10000). The end of the input is indicated by a -1, which should not be processed as a case.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, only one line with a number indicating the total number of chains YaoYao can have at most of length n. The answer should be print after module 9997.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
7
12

Hint
We can see when the length equals to 4. We can have those chains:
0000,0001,0010,0011
0100,0110,0111,1000
1001,1100,1110,1111
